net.sf.JRecord.Details

Interface AbstractLine

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AbstractIndexedLine, ILineFieldNames
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseLine, BasicLine, CharLine, CsvLine, Line, ListLine, XmlLine

    public interface AbstractLine
extends ILineFieldNames
    Interface to represent one Line in a file. Used through out JRecord / RecordEditor

    The one important method is getFieldValue

    Creating: 

                  AbstractLine outLine = new Line(oLayout);
     or
              AbstractLine outLine = new XmlLine(oLayout, recordIdx);

    Getting a field value: 

                        long sku = saleRecord.getFieldValue("KEYCODE-NO").asLong();

    Updating a field: 

                        saleRecord.getFieldValue("KEYCODE-NO").set(1331);
    Author:
    Bruce Martin

      • replace

        void replace(byte[] rec,
           int start,
           int len)
        This method completely replaces a lines value. It is used to determine a records prefered record layout
        Parameters:
        rec - buffer holding the record
        start - Start of the record
        len - length of the record

      • isDefined

        boolean isDefined(int rec,
                int fldNum)
        Check if a field is defined in the record (or line).
        For Csv / Xml files, the field must exist in the "record"
        For Fixed width files
        • The record must be long enough to hold the field
        • The field value must not be hex zero's. This creates a potential problem with Comp fields.
        Parameters:
        rec - Record Index
        fldNum - Field Index
        Returns:
        wether the field exists in the line

      • isDefined

        boolean isDefined(IFieldDetail fld)
        Check if a field is defined in the record (or line).
        For Csv / Xml files, the field must exist in the "record"
        For Fixed width files
        • The record must be long enough to hold the field
        • The field value must not be hex zero's. This creates a potential problem with Comp fields.
        Parameters:
        fld - field-defi9ni9tion
        Returns:
        wether the field exists in the line
